thread.title: Ethiopia: Urban Food Security Programme

title: Ethiopia: Urban Food Security Programme
text:
Zambia: Soldiers Not Yet Paid for Last Month By Solomon Mekonnen 
The Ministry of Urban Development and Construction announced that a 10 billion Birr three-year programmme on cities' food security and job creation would be launched in 11 cities this Ethiopian year. 
Speaking at Federal Micro and Small Enterprises National Council meeting here Wednesday, Minister Mekuria Haile said that the programme is believed to benefit five million citizens. Gradually, it will be expanded to other cities after evaluating in the 11 cities, he added. 
The Minister also said that the programme embraces three components providing direct financial support for those who are not able to work, giving different skill related training's for those who can work and creating job opportunities for the jobless. 
Recalling the support provided to strengthen micro and small institutions into medium industry, Mekuria said that during GTP I period over 5,400 micro and small enterprises were lifted to middle scale industries. 
Federal Micro and Small Enterprises Development Agency Director Gebre-Meskel Chala on his part said: "We are witnessing several improvements on micro and small-scale enterprises despite insufficient electric power supply, technological gap, finance and market link problems that are still challenging the rapid growth of the sector. The Agency is aggressively working in collaboration with stakeholders to address the problem, he added. 
He also said that during the GTP I period it was planned to create job opportunities for 3.2 million citizens, but 10.6 million jobs have been created surpassing the plan. Road, railway, sugar development, power generation, irrigation and housing development were among the sectors that created massive job opportunities, Gebre-Meskel added. 
According to him, it is planned to create 8 million jobs in GTP II giving priority to the manufacturing sector. Ethiopia
